data.title: Catalogue — Arion Press
data.meta_description: A complete list of Arion Press publications to date
data.text:
#124: Poe's Phantasia by Edgar Allan Poe

With artwork by Natalie Frank, a foreword by Chris Semtner and an introduction by Ed Schad. Composed of two volumes: Poe's Phantasia and The Raven. 300 copies for sale: 350 Fine Press edition; 50 Deluxe edition. Deluxe edition is accompanied by extra acrylic print en chemise of one of Natalie Frank's images for The Raven, signed by the artist. 2023.

#122: Woolgathering by Patti Smith

With a new foreword and unpublished "porch song" by the author and featuring thirteen photograms by Christian Marclay. 300 copies for sale: 250 Limited edition; 50 Deluxe edition. Deluxe copies are presented in translucent etched acrylic slipcases. Deluxe copies are accompanied by numbered and signed gravure with chine collé "The New World". 2022.

#120: Morte de Smudgie by Margaret Atwood

A new exclusive original short story from Margaret Atwood about loss and Alfred, Lord Tennyson’s classic poem, “Morte d’Arthur”, that it references. Artwork by Audrey Niffenegger. 250 copies for sale plus 26 copies hors commerce signed by the author and the artist: 190 Limited edition; 45 Variant edition; 15 Deluxe edition. Variant and Deluxe copies are bound in a modified dos-à-dos structure. Deluxe copies are accompanied by numbered and signed aquatint “Now Farewell”. 2021.

Additional aquatint “Shelter”: 15 copies numbered and signed by the artist, 2021.

#118: Sea of Cortez: A Leisurely Journal of Travel and Research by John Steinbeck and Edward F. Ricketts

6 woodblock engravings by Richard Wagener, a map illustration by Martin Machado, and a foreword by Jeffrey Yang. 250 copies for sale plus 26 copies hors commerce signed by Wagener: 185 Limited edition; 25 Variant edition; 40 Deluxe edition. Deluxe copies are presented in handmade artisanal boxes that incorporate planks salvaged from the Western Flyer. 2020.

#116: The Odes of Horace, Book II A new verse translation by Michael Taylor, with his commentary and introduction; with 21 duotone photographs of sea stones by Dennis Letbetter. 150 Limited edition copies plus 26 copies hors commerce, signed by the translator and the artist. Deluxe edition in variant binding with accompanying gelatin silver photographic print: 30 numbered copies, signed by the translator and the artist, 2019.

#108: The Little of Our Earthly Trust by Elizabeth Bishop

Poetry selected and with an introduction by Helen Vendler with 24 prints by John Newman. 300 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the artist.

Additional hand-colored print, “North and South”. 30 prints numbered and signed by the artist, 2016.

#101: What the End is For by Jorie Graham

Introductory essay by Helen Vendler with 16 prints by Julian Lethbridge. 300 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the poet and the artist.

Portfolio of four three-color prints. 30 sets numbered and signed by the artist, 2014.

#93: Poetry of Sappho

In Greek with English translation by John Daley with Page duBois, with 23 wood engravings by Anita Cowles Rearden and 20 prints by Julie Mehretu. 400 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the artist.

Portfolio of four relief prints, “Sapphic Strophes”, three of them hand-colored. 40 sets numbered and signed by the artist, 2011.

#86: Don Quixote, Book I by Miguel de Cervantes

Translated by Edith Grossman, with 42 prints by William T. Wiley. 400 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the artist, 2009.

Additional print, “Don Quixote visits a printing house in Barcelona”. 40 copies numbered and signed by the artist.

Text broadside describing the printing house visit, printed by Columbian iron handpress. 200 copies.

#77: Godot

An imaginary staging by William T. Wiley of Waiting for Godot, with an introduction by David Littlejohn and program note and synopsis by Andrew Hoyem. 300 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the artist. Out of print.

Additional hand-colored print. 50 unique images from the book, signed by the artist, 2006.

#71: The Theory of Relativity by Albert Einstein

Centennial edition of the two key papers of 1905 with foreword, annotations, and afterword by Professor Richard A. Muller and a frontispiece portrait of the author by Blake Riley. 400 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, 2005.

#69: 13 Watercolor drawings by William Blake illustrating Paradise Lost

Portfolio of 13 facsimiles of watercolor drawings reproduced at full scale from the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library. Published to accompany #64, Paradise Lost. Descriptions and commentaries by Robert N. Essick and John T. Shawcross. Published on demand, not to exceed 400 copies, 2004. Currently unavailable.

#63: The Ballad of Lemon & Crow by Glenn Todd

With six photogravures by Bruce Conner and anonymous artists. 300 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the author and the artist.

Portfolio of six larger prints alongside prose-poems by Todd. 30 sets numbered and signed by the artist, 2002.

#62: Arcadia by Tom Stoppard

Foreword by the playwright, introduction by Diana Ketcham, with four watercolor reproductions by William Matthews. 400 numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the playwright and the artist.

Portfolio of four prints. 50 sets numbered and signed by the artist, 2001.

#61: The Voices of Marrakesh by Elias Canetti

Translated by J.A. Underwood, with an afterword by Ferdinand Protzman, 29 photographs by Karl Bissinger, and six etchings by William T. Wiley. 350 total numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the artist and the photographer.

Special edition binding with leather spine. 50 numbered copies sold with the large etching “Canetti in Marrakesh”, signed by the artist, 2001.

#59: Cane by Jean Toomer

Introduction by Leon Litwack and ten woodblock prints by Martin Puryear. 400 total numbered copies plus 26 hors de commerce, signed by the artist.

Special edition binding in full leather. 50 copies in wooden slipcase accompanied by a portfolio of seven woodblock prints, signed by the artist, 2000. Out of print.
